metadata.title: CVE-2024-40630 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: OpenImageIO is a toolset for reading, writing, and manipulating image filesof any image file format relevant to VFX / animation via a format-agnosticAPI with a feature set, scalability, and robustness needed for feature filmproduction. In affected versions there is a bug in the heif inputfunctionality of OpenImageIO. Specifically, in`HeifInput::seek_subimage()`.  In the worst case, this can lead to aninformation disclosure vulnerability, particularly for programs thatdirectly use the `ImageInput` APIs. This bug has been addressed in commit`0a2dcb4c` which is included in the 2.5.13.1 release. Users are advised toupgrade. There are no known workarounds for this issue.

criterions.comment: openimageio package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
